definitions.definition: a piece of furniture with a flat top and one or more legs, providing a level surface on which objects may be placed, and that can be used for such purposes as eating, writing, working, or playing games.
examples: stand, dining table, kitchen table, coffee table; Morecounter, work surface, worktable, workbench; bar, buffet; desk; nightstand "put the plates on the table"Morecounter, work surface, worktable, workbench; bar, buffet; desk; nightstand put the plates on the table

definitions.definition: food provided in a restaurant or household.
examples: he was reputed to have the finest French table of the time
synonyms: nosh; literaryviands; datedvictuals "he provides an excellent table"

definitions.definition: a group seated at a table for a meal.
examples: the whole table was in gales of laughter

definitions.definition: a meeting place or forum for formal discussions held to settle an issue or dispute.
the dummy hand (which is exposed on the table).
examples: they made the hand easily with the aid of a club ruff on the table

definitions.definition: a set of facts or figures systematically displayed, especially in columns.
examples: the population has grown, as shown in table 1

definitions.definition: a collection of data stored in memory as a series of records, each defined by a unique key stored with it.
a flat, typically rectangular, vertical surface.
a horizontal molding, especially a cornice.
a slab of wood or stone bearing an inscription.
a flat surface of a gem.
a cut gem with two flat faces.
each half or quarter of a folding board for backgammon.

examples: I'd like the issue to be tabled for the next few months
synonyms: put on the back burner "the council tabled the rezoning issue until April"

definitions.definition: present formally for discussion or consideration at a meeting.
examples: an MP tabled an amendment to the bill
